title: Cat. 80.2  Mahana atua (Day of the God), 1894/95, printed and published 1921
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Printed by Pola Gauguin (1883–1961)  
Published by Christian Cato, Copenhagen  
Mahana atua (Day of the God)  
1894/95, printed and published 1921  
Second state of two  
Wood-block print in black ink on grayish-ivory China paper; 182 × 203 mm (image); 267 × 429 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, the Joseph Brooks Fair Collection, 1924.1195  
Kornfeld 31 II/II, C,b  
For the verso, see fig. 80.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Sold by Thomas W. Schreiner, New York, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1924.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Chicago, Renaissance Society, Some Modern Primitives: International Exhibition of Paintings and Prints, July 2–Aug. 16, 1931, no cat.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 144, cat. 31.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed in wood block, lower left, printed in white-line manner: P G O

Inscribed in wood block, lower right, in white-line manner: Mahana Atua

Signed lower right, below image, in pale silvery-purple graphite (copy pencil?): Pola Gauguin imp

Inscribed lower left, below image, in pale silvery-purple graphite (copy pencil?): Paul Gauguin fait

Inscribed upper left, above image, in pale silvery-purple graphite (copy pencil?): no 50

Collection stamp in oval, lower left, in brown ink: THE ART / INSTITUTE OF / CHICAGO

Inscribed lower left, in graphite: A. I. C. / 24.1195 / acc. no. 6387 [partially erased]

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">See http://www.renaissancesociety.org/publishing/519/some-modern-primitives-works-in-exhibition/.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 80.2 Mahana atua (Day of the God), 1894/95, printed and published 1921.

fig. 80.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Mahana atua (Day of the God) (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 1924.1195.

</section>
